intro: Homalanthus goodenoviensis, commonly known as the Goodenow's cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in wet, disturbed soils along stream banks and in swampy areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. The species is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
